intro: Thlaspi trojagense, commonly known as the Trojagense cress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a small annual herb that typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in mountainous regions. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually lobed or divided. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, and it is adapted to harsh, alpine environments. Thlaspi trojagense is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and withstand cold temperatures.
